summary: This is a notice from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding a defective document filing in the case United States v. Maxwell. The defective document is an acknowledgment and notice of appearance filed on behalf of appellant Ghislaine Maxwell, and the notice is electronically mailed to her attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case United States v. Maxwell, for whom a defective acknowledgment and notice of appearance was filed.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, who is electronically mailed the notice regarding the defective document filing.

persons.name: David Oscar Markus
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of the notice, indicating involvement as a prosecutor in the case.

connections.description: Bobbi C. Sternheim is the attorney of record filing documents on behalf of appellant Ghislaine Maxwell.
David Oscar Markus is an Assistant U.S. Attorney involved in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Defective Document Filing Notice
events.description: The Second Circuit Court of Appeals filed a notice regarding a defective acknowledgment and notice of appearance document submitted on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: A defective document (acknowledgment and notice of appearance) was filed on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell in her appellate case (21-770).
The notice of the defective filing was electronically mailed to Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim.
Assistant U.S. Attorney David Oscar Markus is listed as a recipient, indicating his role in the prosecution.
